documents.document: @iainl7 I forgot about this I'll have to catch up. But I love Rochelle because she doesn't know how to do this stuff because why should she.

Q: Who has a greater fear of stairs & is less in touch with reality than the president? A: Me, with my dissociative seizures

Your big old inefficient freezing cold kitchen. Kippers are fine. A wee galley kitchen all tight and warm, the stink infects everything

@TheSimonEvans @johnmitchinson Difficult thing, tv turns on a pin with populist vs academic. Meades is one of the few that can do both.

@greg_jenner @FernRiddell Oh Freud is impactful but only in in the way I'd impact on his bollocks if I ever met him. #Dissociative
@greg_jenner @FernRiddell But the most influential academic book since 1900?
@greg_jenner @FernRiddell 1700? Then Adam Smith would be *far* more influential. Post 1900 then Keynes is the economic pin
@greg_jenner @FernRiddell P.S. Modern Ireland by Roy Foster is a double threat. Brilliant academic book, brilliant popular history.
@LFBarfe He's found some Fred Emney Picks a Pop
@greg_jenner @FernRiddell Note the point of your book prize. "Modern" academic
@greg_jenner @FernRiddell It's easy to get a prÃ©cis of Keynes work because he's a past figure. But it's moved on in 80 years.
@greg_jenner @FernRiddell If you want to get into modern social economics then Amatya Sen is the game changer today.
@greg_jenner @FernRiddell Keynes' work is great but it does have the whiff of modern politics about it, like everyone buying Piketty
@greg_jenner @FernRiddell Hmm, I bet 10 years ago he'd be in the long list only
@FernRiddell @greg_jenner And Keynes as your 'modern' economic thinker when you could have Sen?
